paper_abstract: XDIA is a computational strategy for analyzing multiplexed spectra acquired using electron transfer dissociation and collision- activated dissociation; it significantly increases identified spectra (similar to 250%) and unique peptides (similar to 30%) when compared with the data-dependent ETCaD analysis on middle-down, single-phase shotgun proteomic analysis. Increasing identified spectra and peptides improves quantitation statistics confidence and protein coverage, respectively.
paper_title: XDIA: improving on the label-free data-independent analysis
